by-components.description: The Kubernetes Controller Manager must create unique service accounts for each work payload.
MongoDB must integrate with an organization-level authentication/access mechanism providing account management and automation for all users, groups, roles, and any other principals.
MySQL Database Server 8.0 must integrate with an organization-level authentication/access mechanism providing account management and automation for all users, groups, roles, and any other principals.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

The Kubernetes API Server must enable Node,RBAC as the authorization mode.
The Kubernetes Scheduler must have secure binding.
The Kubernetes Controller Manager must have secure binding.
The Kubernetes API server must have the insecure port flag disabled.
The Kubernetes Kubelet must have the read-only port flag disabled.
The Kubernetes API server must have the insecure bind address not set.
The Kubernetes API server must have the secure port set.
The Kubernetes API server must have anonymous authentication disabled.
The Kubernetes Kubelet must have anonymous authentication disabled.
The Kubernetes kubelet must enable explicit authorization.
Kubernetes Worker Nodes must not have sshd service running.
Kubernetes Worker Nodes must not have the sshd service enabled.
Kubernetes dashboard must not be enabled.
Kubernetes Kubectl cp command must give expected access and results.
The Kubernetes kubelet static PodPath must not enable static pods.
Kubernetes DynamicAuditing must not be enabled.
Kubernetes DynamicKubeletConfig must not be enabled.
The Kubernetes API server must have Alpha APIs disabled.
Kubernetes must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures or the installation of patches and updates.
MongoDB must enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
MongoDB must enforce discretionary access control policies, as defined by the data owner, over defined subjects and objects.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must enforce discretionary access control policies, as defined by the data owner, over defined subjects and objects.
Firewall traversal from remote host must be disabled.

Google Data Synchronization must be disabled.
Cloud print sharing must be disabled.

The Kubernetes API server must have the ValidatingAdmissionWebhook enabled.
Kubernetes must have a pod security policy set.
Execution of software modules (to include stored procedures, functions, and triggers) with elevated privileges must be restricted to necessary cases only.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures or the installation of patches and updates.
MongoDB must enforce discretionary access control policies, as defined by the data owner, over defined subjects and objects.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions, to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures.
MySQL Database Server 8.0  must limit the number of concurrent sessions to an organization-defined number per user for all accounts and/or account types.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must automatically terminate a user session after organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect.
MongoDB must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in storage.
MongoDB must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in storage.
MongoDB must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in storage.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in transmission.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in process.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must associate organization-defined types of security labels having organization-defined security label values with information in storage.
The Kubernetes API Server must prohibit communication using TLS version 1.0 and 1.1, and SSL 2.0 and 3.0.

The Kubernetes Controller Manager must use TLS 1.2, at a minimum, to protect the confidentiality of sensitive data during electronic dissemination.
The Kubernetes Scheduler must use TLS 1.2, at a minimum, to protect the confidentiality of sensitive data during electronic dissemination.
The Kubernetes API Server must use TLS 1.2, at a minimum, to protect the confidentiality of sensitive data during electronic dissemination.
The Kubernetes etcd must use TLS to protect the confidentiality of sensitive data during electronic dissemination.
The Kubernetes etcd must use TLS to protect the confidentiality of sensitive data during electronic dissemination.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MySQL Database Server 8.0  must produce audit records containing sufficient information to establish what type of events occurred.

Kubernetes API Server must generate audit records that identify what type of event has occurred, identify the source of the event, contain the event results, identify any users, and identify any containers associated with the event.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must include additional, more detailed, organizationally defined information in the audit records for audit events identified by type, location, or subject.

MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must utilize centralized management of the content captured in audit records generated by all components of MongoDB.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must utilize centralized management of the content captured in audit records generated by all components of the MySQL Database Server 8.0.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must provide centralized configuration of the content to be captured in audit records generated by all components of the MySQL Database Server 8.0.
MongoDB must allocate audit record storage capacity in accordance with site audit record storage requirements.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must allocate audit record storage capacity in accordance with organization-defined audit record storage requirements.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must off-load audit data to a separate log management facility; this must be continuous and in near real time for systems with a network connection to the storage facility and weekly or more often for stand-alone systems.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
MongoDB must provide a warning to appropriate support staff when allocated audit record storage volume reaches 75% of maximum audit record storage capacity.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must provide a warning to appropriate support staff when allocated audit record storage volume reaches 75 percent of maximum audit record storage capacity.
MongoDB must provide audit record generation for DoD-defined auditable events within all DBMS/database components.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must provide an immediate real-time alert to appropriate support staff of all audit log failures.

MongoDB software installation account must be restricted to authorized users.
Database software, including DBMS configuration files, must be stored in dedicated directories, or DASD pools, separate from the host OS and other applications.

User-managed resources must be created in dedicated namespaces.

Publishing calendars to Office Online must be prevented.
Publishing to a Web Distributed and Authoring (DAV) server must be prevented.
Level of calendar details that a user can publish must be restricted.
Access restriction settings for published calendars must be configured.
Outlook Security Mode must be configured to use Group Policy settings.
Trusted add-ins behavior for email must be configured.
Send all signed messages as clear signed messages must be configured.
Automatic sending  s/Mime receipt requests must be disallowed.
External content and pictures in HTML email must be displayed.
Automatic download content for email in Safe Senders list must be disallowed.
Permit download of content from safe zones must be configured.
IE Trusted Zones assumed trusted must be blocked.
Internet with Safe Zones for Picture Download must be disabled.
Intranet with Safe Zones for automatic picture downloads must be configured.
Hyperlinks in suspected phishing email messages must be disallowed.
Disabling download full text of articles as HTML must be configured.
Outlook must be configured not to prompt users to choose security settings if default settings fail.
Replies or forwards to signed/encrypted messages must be signed/encrypted.
Check e-mail addresses against addresses of certificates being used must be disallowed.
Read EMail as plain text must be enforced.
Read signed email as plain text must be enforced.
The default message format must be set to use Plain Text.
Outlook Rich Text options must be set for converting to plain text format.
Text in Outlook that represents internet and network paths must not be automatically turned into hyperlinks.

MongoDB must be configured in accordance with the security configuration settings based on DoD security configuration and implementation guidance, including STIGs, NSA configuration guides, CTOs, DTMs, and IAVMs.

Metrics reporting to Google must be disabled.
Search suggestions must be disabled.

WebUSB must be disabled.
Google Cast must be disabled.
Autoplay must be disabled.

User Entries to Server List must be disallowed.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users).

Outlook must be configured to force authentication when connecting to an Exchange server.
Secrets in Kubernetes must not be stored as environment variables.

If passwords are used for authentication, MongoDB must store only hashed, salted representations of passwords.

If Database Management System (DBMS) authentication using passwords is employed, the DBMS must enforce the DoD standards for password complexity and lifetime.

If passwords are used for authentication, the MySQL Database Server 8.0 must transmit only encrypted representations of passwords.
Online revocation checks must be performed.
Retrieving of CRL data must be set for online action.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must prohibit the use of cached authenticators after an organization-defined time period.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must use NIST FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules for cryptographic operations.

MongoDB must protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.

MongoDB must implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized modification of organization-defined information at rest (to include, at a minimum, PII and classified information) on organization-defined information system components.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must implement cryptographic mechanisms preventing the unauthorized disclosure of organization-defined information at rest on organization-defined information system components.

The version of Google Chrome running on the system must be a supported version.
Kubernetes must contain the latest updates as authorized by IAVMs, CTOs, DTMs, and STIGs.

MongoDB must check the validity of all data inputs except those specifically identified by the organization.
MongoDB and associated applications must reserve the use of dynamic code execution for situations that require it.

The MySQL Database Server 8.0 must check the validity of all data inputs except those specifically identified by the organization.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 and associated applications must reserve the use of dynamic code execution for situations that require it.
The MySQL Database Server 8.0 and associated applications, when making use of dynamic code execution, must scan input data for invalid values that may indicate a code injection attack.
When invalid inputs are received, MongoDB must behave in a predictable and documented manner that reflects organizational and system objectives.
When invalid inputs are received, the MySQL Database Server 8.0 must behave in a predictable and documented manner that reflects organizational and system objectives.
Chrome development tools must be disabled.
MongoDB must provide non-privileged users with error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited by adversaries.
MongoDB must reveal detailed error messages only to the ISSO, ISSM, SA, and DBA.
